abstract: A spate of infections, leaving some patients blind, has caused some physicians to choose the more expensive Lucentis for eye disease in the elderly.
snippet: A spate of infections, leaving some patients blind, has caused some physicians to choose the more expensive Lucentis for eye disease in the elderly.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Robert Feig, a retina specialist in Brooklyn and the Bronx, says he wants to save patients and Medicare money by treating eye diseases with a drug that costs $50 a dose, rather than one that costs $2,000 a dose.

headline.main: Doctors Grow Wary of Avastin for Eye Treatment
